definition: name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade

sentences.english: Thee love of royal celebrities has always been staged for the world to see.
sentences.chinese: 皇室名流們的愛情總是如戲劇般上演，受到世人矚目。

sentences.english: How often do celebrities need security?
sentences.chinese: 社會名流有多經常需要保護措施？

sentences.english: But what of Mrs. Longworth, the celebrated Washington socialite?
sentences.chinese: 但是沃思夫人呢，華府的名流？

sentences.english: In the theater of celebrity tragedy, each play has three acts.
sentences.chinese: 在上演名流悲劇的戲院裏，每一齣戲都有三幕。

sentences.english: If Hurstwood had one leaning, it was toward notabilities .
sentences.chinese: 倘若赫斯渥有什麼可傾心的，那就是傾心名流。

sentences.english: Authorities freed the socialite early this morning.
sentences.chinese: 當局於今晨較早的時間釋放了該位社交名流。

sentences.english: Ali G guyed celebrities on his show.
sentences.chinese: 阿里克在節目中嘲弄了一衆名流。

sentences.english: Unless you are a celebrity on professional display, forget this consumer theatricality.
sentences.chinese: 除非你是參加專業展覽的名流，否則你就不要再想了。

sentences.english: There are many celebrities, top-class citizens and models at Elite Bar.
sentences.chinese: 精英酒吧有許多名人，社交名流和模特。

sentences.english: This part let young Maliya score a success, ascend body distinguished personages.
sentences.chinese: 這個角色讓年輕的瑪利亞獲得了成功，躋身名流。

sentences.english: Partied with the cream of Old Hollywood.
sentences.chinese: 和舊時好萊塢的名流們一起參加社交聚會。

sentences.english: The new author has become a celebutante since the beginning of the year.
sentences.chinese: 新年伊始，那名新作家就成了名流新寵。

sentences.english: The study of PMS was brought about by many characters in society.
sentences.chinese: 對經前綜合症的研究是由社會許多名流引發的。

sentences.english: He navigates celebrity dinner galas like a seasoned politician.
sentences.chinese: 他遊刃有餘地參加名流晚宴，宛如政壇老將。

sentences.english: Therefore, some celebrities at all in DaSanYuan catering to makes for glory.
sentences.chinese: 因此，當時的一些名流士紳都以在大三元飲宴爲榮耀。

sentences.english: I have been more concerned with the obscure than with the famous.
sentences.chinese: 比之名流顯士，我更加關注無名小卒。

definition: high official and noble persons (idiom); the great and the good
famous scholar/worthy/celebrity, esp. distinguished literary person having no official post
offspring a famous family (idiom); good breeding/blue blood
